personal.name: Nedyalko Andreev
personal.title: Full-Stack Developer
personal.short_bio: Highly skilled generalist developer with more than 12 years of diverse work experience. Interested in security, DevOps, and data wrangling. Currently striving to master Rust and machine learning with Python. Seeking professional opportunities, especially to work on intriguing open source projects.

education.label: Master's (unfinished)
education.name: Master's Program in "Distributed Systems and Mobile Technologies"
education.description: A diversified master's program at the Faculty of Mathematics and Informatics at Sofia University that focuses on designing, building, and interconnecting complex distributed systems. It also has a very wide range of optional courses on networking, security, and system architecture and administration. I have completed all necessary courses, but am yet to defend a thesis.

education.label: Bachelor's Degree
education.name: Bachelor's Degree in Software Engineering
education.description: One of the most highly selective undergraduate programs at the Faculty of Mathematics and Informatics at Sofia University. It offers a balanced course selection that includes many mathematics and computer science subjects as well as courses for project management and soft skills. The diversity of the core course program is only exceeded by the abundance of quality optional courses, of which I took full advantage.

work.label: Consultant
work.name: Consulting and Teaching
work.description: Occasional teaching and consulting/freelance engagements, mostly involving Go, CI/CD/DevOps, and infrastructure security.

work.label: R&D Lead
work.name: Research and Development Lead
work.description: Lead several diverse projects, the biggest of which involved completely overhauling and securing key infrastructure components and CI/CD processes. This included almost total SVN to git migration and introduction of GitLab to the company, automated containerized builds and tests, and the secure compartmentalization of different infrastructure systems.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: A few small node.js projects

work.label: Project Manager
work.name: Project Manager
work.description: I lead a team of 6 people to build and launch iTrend - an innovative alternative to Avus Capital's main service trading212.com that was targeted at novice traders. In the beginning I was also an advisor and mentor to the new NetCredit team (the two companies had the same owners and shared an office).

work.label: Senior Web Developer
work.name: Senior Web Developer
work.description: I was the initial and later the lead developer of NetCredit - a website for short-term loans of small sums of money.

work.label: Freelancer
work.name: Freelance Web Developer
work.description: Development and maintenance of different web projects, mostly in the sphere of e-commerce and insurance.

work.label: Web Developer
work.name: Web Developer
work.description: Development and maintenance of different web projects, mostly e-commerce sites and ad management portals.

work.label: Web Developer
work.name: Web Developer
work.description: Developed a network of websites for sharing links to interesting internet resources, similar to digg.com at the time. All sites shared a common engine, functionality and database, but each one had its own design and content. The project was left unfinished because the company went bankrupt.

work.label: Web Developer
work.name: Web Developer
work.description: Maintained and improved different company web projects, including a system for unified user accounts and scoreboards across dozens of different multiplayer game servers (CS, ScarCraft, WarCraft 2 and 3, Diablo 2, etc.). I participated in the development of two entirely new projects - automated on-demand Xen virtual servers and headoff.mobi - an unsuccessful attempt to create a common country-wide network of wireless access points.

projects.label: CV
projects.name: CV with D3.js Multi-Timeline
projects.description: The somewhat fancy and rather over-complicated CV you are probably looking at right now :). It started as an attempt to grok the D3.js library and ES6 and grew from there...

projects.label: eBook Tools
projects.name: eBook Tools
projects.description: A relatively sophisticated collection of shell scripts for automated and semi-automated organization and management of large ebook collections.

projects.label: git-annex archive
projects.name: Multi-{TB,location,cloud} Backup System
projects.description: A semi-automated git-annex archive setup for dozens of terabytes of information that spans 3 physical locations and 2.5 clouds.

projects.label: Go Course
projects.name: Golang Crash Course
projects.description: An intensive Go language course for some of the developers at Chaos Group.

projects.label: DevOps Consultant
projects.name: DevOps & Infrastructure Security Consulting
projects.description:
I helped while the company restructured their infrastructure team. Some of my responsibilities were:
  • Improving and securing key internal CI/CD processes.
  • Transitioning automation jobs from Jenkins to GitLab CI with Docker containers.
  • Preparing proof-of-concept solutions for integrated testing and production environments with different container management software. For instance, one PoC used docker compose for integration tests of complex interconnected applications. Another PoC used Docker Cloud (and later Kubernetes on Google Cloud) as a trial for future management of multiple production services.
  • Integrating LetsEncrypt to replace self-signed certificates in a lot of the CI infrastructure.
  • Helping with the dissemination of DevOps knowledge, hiring new people and teaching a short Golang crash course.

projects.label: nedomi
projects.name: nedomi
projects.description: nedomi is an open-source high performance caching HTTP reverse proxy written in Go. It was developed for a CDN service that specializes in delivering video content and was able to handle 6 Gbps of production traffic on one server.

projects.label: Golang Courses
projects.name: Golang University Courses
projects.description: I was one of the teachers in the last three additions of an elective crouse on the Go programming language at Sofia University's Faculty of Mathematics and Informatics.

projects.label: iTrend
projects.name: iTrend
projects.description: iTrend was an innovative alternative to Avus Capital's main service trading212.com. It offered a simpler and more visual trading experience and was targeted at novice users. I lead a team of 6 people to build and launch it.

projects.label: NetCredit
projects.name: NetCredit
projects.description: NetCredit is a service for short-term loans of small sums of money. I was the only backend developer initially, and with one frontend developer and one designer we managed to launch the service in only 2 months from scratch. Later the team grew and I was the lead developer until 2013 when I gradually transitioned to iTrend project manager.

skills.name: Data Wrangling
skills.description: I created a highly customizable BI system in the backend administrative interface. It could be used for searching, aggregating, exporting, and plotting arbitrary data directly in the application, without the need to use external tools.

projects.label: Xen VPSes
projects.name: Xen On-Demand Virtual Servers
projects.description: The cloud in 2006... sort of :). We made a system for automated on-demand customizable Xen servers. From our web interface you could create new VMs with custom resources, automatically install your preferred Linux distribution and have them running in a few minutes. After that you could log in via ssh or manage the VM entirely through the web interface. The billing was on a monthly basis, but that was a business decision - our freely-accessible online demo created a new test server on demand and automatically destroyed it in an hour.

projects.label: BitTorrent Tracker
projects.name: BitTorrent Tracker
projects.description: Learned PHP while developing a small torrent website and tracker for... let's go with "linux ISOs"...
